sequenceNumber.description: Sequence to insert to/delete from existing route. Prefix lists are evaluated starting with the lowest sequence number and continue down the list until a match is made. Once a match is made, the permit or deny statement is applied to that network and the rest of the list is ignored.

items.description:
`Internet` - Advertise routes to internet community.
 `LocalAS` - Advertise routes to only localAS peers.
 `NoAdvertise` - Don't advertise routes to any peer.
`NoExport` - Don't export to next AS.
`GShut` - Graceful Shutdown (GSHUT) withdraw routes before terminating BGP connection.

communityMembers.description: List the community members of IP Community.

items.description: Community member of the IP Community. The expected formats are AA:NN >> example 65535:65535, <integer32> >> example 4294967040. The possible values of AA, NN are 0-65535 and <integer32> are 1-4294967040.

networkFabricSku.description: Supported Network Fabric SKU.Example: Compute / Aggregate racks. Once the user chooses a particular SKU, only supported racks can be added to the Network Fabric. The SKU determines whether it is a single / multi rack Network Fabric.

items.description: Router Id of CE to be used for MP-BGP between PE and CE

networkFabricControllerId.description: Azure resource ID for the NetworkFabricController the NetworkFabric belongs.

rackCount.description: Number of compute racks associated to Network Fabric.

serverCountPerRack.description: Number of servers.Possible values are from 1-16.

fabricASN.description: ASN of CE devices for CE/PE connectivity.

terminalServerConfiguration.description: Network and credentials configuration currently applied to terminal server.

username.description: Username for the terminal server connection.

password.description: Password for the terminal server connection.

networkDeviceId.description: ARM Resource ID used for the NetworkDevice.

action.description: Action to be taken on the configuration. Example: Permit | Deny.

sequenceNumber.description: Sequence to insert to/delete from existing route. Prefix lists are evaluated starting with the lowest sequence number and continue down the list until a match is made. Once a match is made, the permit or deny statement is applied to that network and the rest of the list is ignored.

items.description:
`Internet` - Advertise routes to internet community.
 `LocalAS` - Advertise routes to only localAS peers.
 `NoAdvertise` - Don't advertise routes to any peer.
`NoExport` - Don't export to next AS.
`GShut` - Graceful Shutdown (GSHUT) withdraw routes before terminating BGP connection.

communityMembers.description: List the community members of IP Community.

items.description: Community member of the IP Community. The expected formats are AA:NN >> example 65535:65535, <integer32> >> example 4294967040. The possible values of AA, NN are 0-65535 and <integer32> are 1-4294967040.

Once a match is made, the permit or deny statement is applied to that network and the rest of the list is ignored.

items.description:
`Internet` - Advertise routes to internet community.
 `LocalAS` - Advertise routes to only localAS peers.
 `NoAdvertise` - Don't advertise routes to any peer.
`NoExport` - Don't export to next AS.
`GShut` - Graceful Shutdown (GSHUT) withdraw routes before terminating BGP connection.

communityMembers.description: List the community members of IP Community.
